intro: Psilogramme domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican psilogramme, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its small, white flowers appear in umbels, and it produces small, oval fruits. Due to habitat loss, Psilogramme domingensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
